intro: Bermudiana jamesonii, commonly known as the Bermuda buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Bermuda. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, green fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
